legal_basis: Convention Refugee definition under the Immigration Act
risk_of_persecution: well-founded fear of persecution based on race, religion, nationality, social group, or political opinion
decision_reasoning: applicant did not have a well-founded fear of persecution despite being part of a particular social group ('young female, rural Fujianese')
evidence_assessment: voluntary migration and lack of evidence for severe state persecution upon return
conclusion_outcome: CRDD's decision was upheld; the applicant failed to prove a well-founded fear of persecution
cause_of_action: Applicant sought refugee status after being smuggled into Canada from China
procedure_followed: Judicial review analyzed CRDD's decision on constitutional validity, trafficking as persecution, and state persecution
result_of_case: Application for judicial review dismissed; no certified questions granted
